course.subject: ACT
course.title: Applied Database Systems
course.catalogDescription: Emphasis is placed upon the core concepts of relational database application development. Students will gain proficiency in Microsoft Access; the concepts learned will allow the students to apply database application development concepts to a real world type application.

objectives.objective: How tables are used to store data in a pre-defined database.
Relationships between tables utilizing primary and foreign keys.
Relational diagrams and how to build one.
Derived fields using calculations, expressions and functions.
Creation of various types of forms and how they connect to tables.
Creation of various types of report and how they are derived from queries and/or tables.
Data validation techniques in tables, forms and data macros.
